unit.utterance: a... ba tu samula mo tutir ta
unit.utterance_translation: a... we start this story.

unit.utterance: ka mo suda, ba tu semula mo tutir ta
unit.utterance_translation: Are you ready? Then we will start this story.

unit.utterance: mara ling seketir tau dunung, kebo guntir, kebo pèngè,
unit.utterance_translation: As old people said, a buffalo is guntir and a buffalo has a twisted neck.

unit.utterance: aku tutir nènè senèngè
unit.utterance_translation: I will tell (a story), you will hear.

unit.utterance: simir mengkutir rèna nangè
unit.utterance_translation: A catfish jumps while it is swimming.

unit.utterance: sama sebetir tepong dangè masing-masing betangangè
unit.utterance_translation: 'Tepong dangè (a kind of sweet)' of the same small size are taking care of each other.

unit.utterance: a nya cara na
unit.utterance_translation: This is the way (to start the story).
unit.add_comments: nya 'it' refers to the fixed expression of the previous several sentences to start the story

unit.utterance: karing dèta nè ada sópó tau dèta
unit.utterance_translation: Then there was a person there,

unit.utterance: antara sópó keluarga pakir miskin
unit.utterance_translation: in a very poor family.

unit.utterance: hingga nanta tokal barutang baè si
unit.utterance_translation: Then they were just running into the debt.

unit.utterance: mara ling basa tó buka lubang tutup lubang
unit.utterance_translation: like the saying of modern people "opening the hole, closing the hole",

unit.utterance: pinjam uang bayar hutang
unit.utterance_translation: "getting into a debt for paying a debt"

unit.utterance: nanta tau lóka ta, mbang ada anak
unit.utterance_translation: The poor old people, unexpectedly, had children.

unit.utterance: soai sekodeng, salaki sekodeng. deselaki dè rèa
unit.utterance_translation: One is a girl, the other is a boy. The elder one was the boy.

unit.utterance: kira-kira nyondek ta, umir enam tin
unit.utterance_translation: The boy was about six year's old.

unit.utterance: dadi adi ta umir 2 tin
unit.utterance_translation: Then the sister is two year's old.

unit.utterance: Dadi bapa ta, enda boat lin lamin masa tau nanam kè ina ta è
unit.utterance_translation: Then the father doesn't have job. In (lit. if) the season of transplanting of rice seedlings of people overthere, with the mother,

unit.utterance: alo makan gaji nanam ngemat
unit.utterance_translation: went and took wages for planting and pulling out (the rice seedlings).

unit.utterance: karing ina ta, runtung minggu minggu tau datang nagi, marahan ada runtung ano
unit.utterance_translation: Then, as for the mother, people came to her to collect the debt everyweek. They came almost everyday.

unit.utterance: kaselepas utang tó, ada si utang tó.
unit.utterance_translation: After being free from a debt, there was another debt.

unit.utterance: tapi dè paling peno pang utang nè, pang diri setau, dè terakhir nan
unit.utterance_translation: But the most heavy (debt) between the debts was at one person, that is, the one they borrowed last.

unit.utterance: mbang datang katoan kó balé ta è
unit.utterance_translation: Suddenly, he came to the house and asked.

unit.utterance: è anak anak, ling
unit.utterance_translation: "Hey, kids", (he) said. (lit. (His) words were "Hey kids".)

unit.utterance: mé lakó ina mu
unit.utterance_translation: "Where did your mother go?"

unit.utterance: ling tau datang nagi ta è
unit.utterance_translation: the person who came to collect (the debt) said. (lit. The words of person who came to collect (the debt) were "where did your mother go?"..)
unit.add_comments: datang nagi 'come and collect the debt'.

unit.utterance: mala nè (mala=malahan)
unit.utterance_translation: Actually,

unit.utterance: ratusan ribu utang nan
unit.utterance_translation: the debt was about hundred-thousand (rupiah).

unit.utterance: dè pang lin-lin nè, paling-paling sepulu ribu
unit.utterance_translation: (The debts) from other places were ten thousand at the most,

unit.utterance: lima ribu, telu ribu
unit.utterance_translation: or five thousand, or three thousand.

unit.utterance: untuk penyambung hidup setiap hari nè
unit.utterance_translation: for keep living everyday,

unit.utterance: mara ling basa gina tapi cuma pang tau ana gina
unit.utterance_translation: as the saying is. But only from (at) the person overthere,

unit.utterance: pang poko ana è, ratis ribu
unit.utterance_translation: (The debt) from the the person overthere, (the debt) from the main (lender) was hundred thousand.

unit.utterance: kambang-mbang ana, katoan anak ta
unit.utterance_translation: Suddenly, (the man) asked the child.

unit.utterance: è anak anak, ling bling tau lóka ta
unit.utterance_translation: Hey, kid, kid, the old man said. (lit. The words of the old man were 'hey, kid, kid.')

unit.utterance: mé ka lakó bapa mo
unit.utterance_translation: Where did your father go?

unit.utterance: pina kerè apa-apa ling sia papin nè ning
unit.utterance_translation: Please forgive us (lit. (his) words are "you grandfather can make whichever cloth.")

unit.utterance: bapa kaku kalaló sematé tau telas
unit.utterance_translation: My father went for killing people alive.

unit.utterance: ba ina mo ka
unit.utterance_translation: How is your mother?

unit.utterance: kalaló satelas tau maté
unit.utterance_translation: (She) went for reviving a dead person.

unit.utterance: bayamólési ké ina bapa mu ana
unit.utterance_translation: Will your mother and father come back?

unit.utterance: lamin datang ba nó mólé
unit.utterance_translation: If (it) come, ba 'then' (they) will not come home.

unit.utterance: lamin nó datang, ba mólé
unit.utterance_translation: If it will not come, ba (then), (they) will come home.

unit.utterance: nya jawaban anak ta
unit.utterance_translation: It was the answer of the child.

unit.utterance: jadi peki kerantè ta è
unit.utterance_translation: So, the words were (form) a riddle.

unit.utterance: karing bingung tau ta
unit.utterance_translation: So, the man was confused,

unit.utterance: tau kaya ta è.
unit.utterance_translation: the rich man,

unit.utterance: sedang tau ta tau pintar
unit.utterance_translation: Although the person was a clever person,

unit.utterance: mbang nó tó tegas ling nyódék ta
unit.utterance_translation: he didn't know the meaning of the children's word.

unit.utterance: ulang-ulang kadu anak
unit.utterance_translation: "Just repeat (the words), kid."

unit.utterance: tó po ku=menong seda ta aku
unit.utterance_translation: It is the first time for mé to hear the words. (lit. Only now I hear the words.)

unit.utterance: bapa kaji, ling
unit.utterance_translation: "My father",

unit.utterance: kalaló samaté tau telas
unit.utterance_translation: went to kill an alive person.

unit.utterance: ina kaji kalaló satelas tau maté
unit.utterance_translation: My mother went to revive a dead person.

unit.utterance: ih
unit.utterance_translation: Ah...

unit.utterance: bayamólé si bapa mo ina mana? ling bakatoan diri ta
unit.utterance_translation: "Will your father and mother come home?", asked the man. (lit. The man's words are "Will...?")

unit.utterance: jawab ling anak
unit.utterance_translation: The child replied (to him),

unit.utterance: lamin datang ba nó mólé
unit.utterance_translation: "If (it) comes, then ('ba') (they) will not come home."

unit.utterance: lamin nó datang ba mólé
unit.utterance_translation: "If (it) come, then ('ba') (they will) come home."

unit.utterance: wa ina anak ling bling
unit.utterance_translation: "Wah, kids", (he) said. (lit. The words (he) said were...)

unit.utterance: ta lok anak a è, ma mu=bada ku tegas ling kau nan
unit.utterance_translation: "This is the way, kid, I want you to tell mé the meaning."

unit.utterance: lamin mu=bada ku tegas ling ta
unit.utterance_translation: "If you tell mé the meaning", he said, (lit. His words are "if you tell mé the meaning".)

unit.utterance: berarti sarea utang bapa mu nó mo krantè dè pang aku nó lunas
unit.utterance_translation: "Then all the debts of your father, not only the one at mé, will be settled."

unit.utterance: bada ku serèa nè mé pang utang ma ku=selenas aku serèa
unit.utterance_translation: Tell mé the places you have debt. I will settle all.

unit.utterance: lok sate tó tegas seda nan
unit.utterance_translation: I really want to know the meaning of the words (lit. voice).
unit.add_comments: although the structure is a complement clause, it doesn't have a main clause to which it is subordinated, and functions semantically as an exclamatory sentence

unit.utterance: basia pina surat untuk bapa kè ina
unit.utterance_translation: "Then you (should) write a letter for (my) father and mother.

unit.utterance: ma bau saksi ling ina kè bapa lok tanda tangan sia benar ka sia datang
unit.utterance_translation: so that (my) mother and (my) father can prove that you have made a signature and you really came.

unit.utterance: kè benar kalis ling sia ling tode ta è
unit.utterance_translation: and you really utter (that), the child said. (lit. The child's words are utterances 0068 to 0070).

unit.utterance: pina surat ta diri ta
unit.utterance_translation: The man wrote the letter.

unit.utterance: surat kuasa dirita, kè ka pangkeling diri ta è, lok ya tangung jawab
unit.utterance_translation: The authorized letter of man from the man that he assured that

unit.utterance: nó mo krantè utang pang aku, bapa mo ina mo
unit.utterance_translation: (we do) not need to talk about the debt at mé, the mother and father,

unit.utterance: ya nó ku anggap lunas bada ku
unit.utterance_translation: I saw (them) settled.

unit.utterance: bada ku, sarea pang utang dè masi nyangkut nè aku tanggung bayar
unit.utterance_translation: Tell mé all the places where (your) debts still remain, I will pay (all of them).

unit.utterance: asal mu bada ku karoa krantè kau ta
unit.utterance_translation: as long as you would tell mé the meaning of your words.

unit.utterance: ba nó po ku tó tegas
unit.utterance_translation: I don't know the meaning yet.

unit.utterance: tanya lok tegas nde è ling anak ta
unit.utterance_translation: "This is the meaning", Uncle, the child said. (lit. The words of child is .." .")

unit.utterance: bapa ku ka laló sematé tau telas
unit.utterance_translation: My father went to kill an alive person.

unit.utterance: tegas kalaló mat, mat pade telas, karing maté
unit.utterance_translation: The meaning of "(he) went for pulling" is that (he) pulls alive rice plants then (they) will die.

unit.utterance: ina ku nan laló satelas tau maté, ya laló tanam pade ka mat ling bapa ku nan
unit.utterance_translation: "My mother went for reviving a dead person" is (means) "(she) will go for planting rice that my father has pulled."

unit.utterance: we anak balong, topo ke menong seda ta
unit.utterance_translation: Wow, good boy, now I understand the meaning. (lit. Now I heard the voice.)

unit.utterance: tó po kuto tegas, ba mé mo lok
unit.utterance_translation: Now I know the meaning. Then how was...

unit.utterance: ba bakatoan aku, baya mólé si ké, ina kè bapa mu
unit.utterance_translation: Then I will ask you, "Will your mother and father come home?"

unit.utterance: ling kau ita, lamin datang ba nó mólé
unit.utterance_translation: Your words a while ago, "if (it) will not come, then (they) will come home."

unit.utterance: lamin nó datang ba mólé
unit.utterance_translation: "If (it) will not come, then ('ba') (they) will come home."

unit.utterance: ling kau, engka ku tó tegas dèan anak
unit.utterance_translation: I don't understand the meaning of your words, kid.

unit.utterance: ba tanya lok ende è, ling anak ta
unit.utterance_translation: Like this, uncle, the child said.

unit.utterance: malum rabalat brang orong ke desa ta
unit.utterance_translation: As you know, the river and the rice plant was separated from our village.

unit.utterance: tegas ling kaku ling,
unit.utterance_translation: The meaning of my words, he said,

unit.utterance: lamin datang ba... ling
unit.utterance_translation: if the flood comes

unit.utterance: ba nó bau mólé, ina ke bapa, ling kebalat ke ba
unit.utterance_translation: Yes... can't go home, mom and dad, because the flood is blocking it

unit.utterance: lamin nó datang ba, ba mólé ina ke bapa
unit.utterance_translation: If the flood doesn't come, yes, you can go home mom and dad

unit.utterance: nan nya tegas endè è... ling
unit.utterance_translation: That's what uncle means

unit.utterance: wa terima kasi mo anak, salam doa kó ina mu
unit.utterance_translation: Wa... thank you son, my regards to your mother

unit.utterance: salam doa kó bapa mo
unit.utterance_translation: greetings to your father

unit.utterance: utang pang aku bèrès sama sekali
unit.utterance_translation: Debt in my place, pay off

unit.utterance: kè utang pang tau lin akan ku tangung bayar ling aku
unit.utterance_translation: And debts elsewhere, I will pay

unit.utterance: salam doa peno-peno kó bapa mu
unit.utterance_translation: Greetings to your father

unit.utterance: terima kasi mo anak
unit.utterance_translation: Thank you son

unit.utterance: nan si loè na
unit.utterance_translation: Just that

unit.utterance: boè mo tutir ta---boè mo
unit.utterance_translation: Finish this story

unit.utterance: cerita dèan
unit.utterance_translation: That is a story.
